revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=CC&C |model=WA-6210 |revision=-V3 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=05/09/2011 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PANWA6210 |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=USB Female Mini-B |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model=RTL8196C |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=2 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand=ISSI |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8188RE |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports= |wan_ports=1 |flags=portable |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=MyWLAN |default_ssid_regex=^MyWLAN$ |default_ip=192.168.1.254 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:02:72 |oui_eth=00:02:72 }} '''WA-6210-V3''' - ''WLAN 11n Pocket Router''
A newer version of this router may have been released (w/ FCC ID WKLWA6210 [not currently valid]).
"11N RTL8196C V310", "10G029300-0B", and "QEC 6AV0 94V0" is silkscreened on the bottom of the board in the FCC photos.
Default settings are per the FCC manual (which states the model as WA-6210-V3).
A 00:02:72 is presumed to be used per the FCC EUT's MAC label.
The power adapter shown in the FCC photos is a '''DVE''' DSC-5PFC-05 FUS 050100 (100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.2A -> 5VDC, 1A).
